title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 11): Building Power With - Clothing Swaps and Mending Circles for Community Resilience
summary: Organize clothing swaps and mending circles as acts of collective resistance to fast fashion. Build community resilience through collaborative creativity, skill-sharing, and textile care.

Community.summary: Create spaces for sharing skills, resources, and care through collaborative textile practices.

level0: Gather community through local networks and casual meetups
Find accessible, welcoming space for textile sharing
level1: Define shared values through consensus around respect and consent
Organize clothing swap with gift economy principles
level2: Host mending circles with skill-sharing and mutual encouragement
Build community beyond events through food and relationship
level3: Create regular gatherings that deepen relationships and skills
Support network of textile justice activities

Knowledge.summary: Share mending and textile skills while building collective capacity for repair and creativity.

level0: Create culture where skill sharing happens naturally
Invite experienced makers to guide beginners without hierarchy
level1: Celebrate all attempts regardless of skill level
level2: Foster patience and mutual encouragement in learning
Teach textile heritage as resistance to fast fashion
level3: Train others to facilitate mending and swapping events

Narrative.summary: Challenge fast fashion culture through practices of care, repair, and collective abundance.

level0: Practice seeing clothes as worthy of care and longevity
level1: Share stories about textile heritage and traditional skills
Model alternatives to fast fashion consumption
level2: Help others understand clothing swaps as resistance to exploitation
Promote gift economy principles over market exchange
level3: Transform community understanding of textiles and value
Build culture where mending and sharing are celebrated
